creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
A new build target called clear-repository was added to clean up the two
workspaces 'authoring' and 'live'. The import function assures that the same
UUID is used for corresponding nodes in authoring and live workspace.

Created attachment 14511
Changed files
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
The sitetree implementation based on jcr is working now with the default
publication. At the moment, only a minimal(!) set of functionality is supported,
basically only a first view ;-). I post the changes for those who want to
experiment with and have a look at it.

Created attachment 14556
Update of jcrsitetree sources.

Michi, may be you can check it in. It's way better than the stuff before :-)
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
michi@apache.org
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
The JCR based sitetree basically works now. The direct file access to
sitetree.xml is replaced by a SiteTreeGenerator that generates the known
sitetree xml from the SiteTree object directly. Two more workspaces for trash
and archive have been added. There are still some issues (cut & paste,
importSubTree, etc.) that need some work.

creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 14588
Update of jcrsitetree sources.

Michi, can you please check-in the new code. Thanks!

creator: michi@apache.org
text:
I have checked in your recent changes, whereas some of them related to the
SiteTreeGenerator I have checked in into Lenya 1.2.X directly.

But there seems to be a problem re importing the repo and also on language exist.

Thanks

Michi

Thanks Michi for checking in. I did a clean checkout of Lenya and the
jcrsitetree implementation. The import works for me and I didn't see any
problems re language exists.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
Created attachment 14613
Patch for the import process re first namespace registration.

The import does not work the first time because of missing namespace
registration.  The patch fixes this problem.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text:
ok, checked in the patch and it really seems to work now :-)

I should have read the README ;-)
creator: michi@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 14621
Updated sources.

Implemented a repository model (nodetype definitions). Moved to updated
jackrabbit version LCR 159689 which is JAAS enabled. Added repository viewer.
Patched Xalan version. Updated README and build process. New jars will be
commited separately.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
michi@apache.org
text:
checked in everything. Somehow I have some trouble with the repository viewer,
resp. I cannot see the newly created nodes from Lenya.

Will take a closer look again tomorrow.

Thanks

Michi

Created attachment 14643
Patch for changed files.

The JCR sitetree implementation supports now copy and cut. Node locking is an
open issue yet. This patch relies on the changes proposed in bug
http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=34348
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com

text: thanks very much for the patches (patch -p0 < jcrsitetree.diff)
creator: michi@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 14679
Patch for changed files.

Supports now archive, delete, revoke.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
michi@apache.org
text:
works very fine. I have checked it in. Thanks very much.

Are now all "features" implemented?

Michi

Created attachment 14709
Newly added files and dirs

Moved repository for general use by lenya (before: per publication repository).
Added repository factory.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
Created attachment 14710
Diffs of existing files

Reorganized repository structure for general use by lenya for all publications.
Improved import.

thanks very much for the patches. checked them in, whereas I have replaced
servletroot.dir by webapp.dir and removed the blog repo, because the blog
doesn't need a sitetree.

Thanks

Michi
creator: michi@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 14711
Fixed startup of lenya.
creator: felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
michi@apache.org
text:
saving resp. flowscript works now as well.

Thanks

Michi
Can you provide a single patch for 1.4?
creator: gregor@apache.org
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
(In reply to comment #22)
> Can you provide a single patch for 1.4?

Some improvements are still in the pipeline and not yet commited. As soon as the
1.2 version stabilized and proved usable a patch for the 1.4 should be possible,
at least the core ideas will be portable to 1.4.

creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text: JCR integration is a goal for the next version of Lenya. Modification of Lenya 2.x to have proper support for JCR will not happen at this time. Thank you for your submission.
